LanguageData.Fishercat.label: 鱼猫
LanguageData.Fishercat.description: A small mammal of the Marten genus, the Fisher- or alternatively 'Fisher Cat' is neither a fish eater nor a cat. Genetically closer to a weasel, fishers are long bodied but short lived. Considering their small size, fishers are known to be particularly vicious; hunting unusual prey such as porcupines and even young deer.\n\nDespite their cute appearance, fishers are very much wild and not likely to make a good pet.
LanguageData.Ermine.label: 貂
LanguageData.Ermine.description: A nearly pure-white stoat; a smaller member of the weasel family.
